title: List of bowlers who have taken a wicket with their first ball in a format of international cricket
text:
Seventy-one <a href="Bowling%20%28cricket%29">bowlers</a> have taken a <a href="Wicket%20%28dismissal%29">wicket</a> with the very first <a href="Delivery%20%28cricket%29">ball</a> they bowled in one of the three formats of <a href="international%20cricket">international cricket</a>. Twenty bowlers have performed this feat in <a href="Test%20cricket">Test cricket</a>. The first was <a href="Australia%20national%20cricket%20team">Australian</a> <a href="Tom%20Horan">Tom Horan</a>, who dismissed <a href="Walter%20Read">Walter Read</a> with his first ball on 26 January 1883, and the most recent is <a href="South%20African%20national%20cricket%20team">South Africa</a> bowler <a href="Hardus%20Viljoen">Hardus Viljoen</a> who dismissed the <a href="England%20cricket%20team">England</a> captain <a href="Alastair%20Cook">Alastair Cook</a> on 15 January 2016. Seven of these twenty bowlers have been English cricketers. However, this accomplishment has not always led to a long and illustrious career. Only <a href="Maurice%20Tate">Maurice Tate</a>, <a href="Intikhab%20Alam">Intikhab Alam</a> and <a href="Nathan%20Lyon">Nathan Lyon</a> went on to play in more than ten Tests. <a href="Arthur%20Coningham%20%28cricketer%29">Arthur Coningham</a>, <a href="Matt%20Henderson%20%28cricketer%29">Matt Henderson</a>, <a href="Dennis%20Smith%20%28New%20Zealand%20cricketer%29">Dennis Smith</a>, and <a href="Tyrell%20Johnson%20%28cricketer%29">Tyrell Johnson</a> were <a href="One-Test%20wonder">One-Test wonder</a>s, and Smith's only Test wicket was the one he took with his first ball.
In <a href="One%20Day%20International">One Day International</a> (ODI) matches, twenty-nine bowlers have taken a wicket with their first ball. The first to accomplish this was English bowler <a href="Geoff%20Arnold">Geoff Arnold</a>, who <a href="bowled">bowled</a> <a href="Graeme%20Watson%20%28cricketer%29">Graeme Watson</a> on 24 August 1972. The most recent is <a href="Keemo%20Paul">Keemo Paul</a>, from <a href="West%20Indies%20national%20cricket%20team">West Indies</a>, who struck with his debut delivery on 15 March 2018. Not all of these bowlers took their first wicket in their debut match. <a href="Clive%20Lloyd">Clive Lloyd</a>, <a href="Inzamam-ul-Haq">Inzamam-ul-Haq</a>, <a href="Sadagoppan%20Ramesh">Sadagoppan Ramesh</a>, and <a href="Martin%20van%20Jaarsveld">Martin van Jaarsveld</a> did not bowl in their debut matches, and took their first wicket on a later appearance. Ramesh and <a href="Wavell%20Hinds">Wavell Hinds</a> took their first wickets during the same match on 6 September 1999; the former in the first innings of the match and the latter in the second. It was also the only wicket taken by Ramesh during his ODI career.
In <a href="Twenty20%20International">Twenty20 International</a> (T20I) cricket, twenty-two bowlers, including two women, have taken a wicket with their first ball. The first to achieve this feat was Australian <a href="Michael%20Kasprowicz">Michael Kasprowicz</a> who took wickets with his first and second delivery in this format on 17 May 2005, dismissing New Zealand's <a href="Stephen%20Fleming">Stephen Fleming</a> and <a href="Mathew%20Sinclair">Mathew Sinclair</a>. <a href="Hong%20Kong%20national%20cricket%20team">Hong Kong</a>'s <a href="Nadeem%20Ahmed">Nadeem Ahmed</a> and <a href="Nepal%20national%20cricket%20team">Nepal</a>'s <a href="Paras%20Khadka">Paras Khadka</a> took their first wickets during the same match on 16 March 2014; the former in the first innings of the match and the latter in the second.
